titleInfo.title: Key Facts about Child Care and Early Education: A Briefing Book

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This briefing book on child care and early education includes factsheets on a range of child care and early education issues. If includes basic facts about child care and early education, their importance to children, families, abd communities, some of the challenges facing families who need child care and early education, and information on key child care and early education policies and programs. A series of factsheets on the importance of good quality care, the importance of child care to help families work, the inadequacy of the supply of care, and a list of the various programs and policies that help families understand the roles played by federal, state, and local governments as well as private and public sectors. 50-state date, including maternal labor force participation, the number of regulated child care settings, the percent of schools offering extended day programs, selected child care licensing regulations, preschool participation rates of poor children, state rankings on financial commitment to child care and early education, the number of children participating in the Child and Adult Health Food Program (CACFP), and the number of children participating in Head Start are also included.
